pull.title: Updated README.md
pull.body: Improved sentence construction and grammatical flow of introductory paragraph.

events.message:
Updated Readme.md

Improved sentence construction and grammatical flow of introductory paragraph.

Updated Readme.md _ reverted its to the

Reverted  "its network" back to "the network"

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4729_e070c125db26001cbe42278a1d6f6374dc469135/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
I actually find that the flow of the paragraph was much cleaner in the previous form.
@TheBlueMatt That was definitely not a response I was looking for, lol. Closing, and trying again.

@bitcoinsSG Sorry for that! My gut feeling is that you'll get more positive response to a documentation commit if you document things that are not documented right now or need to be explained more thoroughly.

These are a few ancient phrases that people have gotten so used to over time, that any change looks 'weird'.
@laanwj no problem. I appreciate the insight and explanation; they make a lot of sense. I'll keep your suggestions in mind for the next pull request. Thanks again.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,11 +8,9 @@ Copyright (c) 2009-2014 Bitcoin Core Developers
 What is Bitcoin?
 ----------------
 
-Bitcoin is an experimental new digital currency that enables instant payments to
+Bitcoin is a new experimental digital currency that enables instant payments to
 anyone, anywhere in the world. Bitcoin uses peer-to-peer technology to operate
-with no central authority: managing transactions and issuing money are carried
-out collectively by the network. Bitcoin Core is the name of open source
-software which enables the use of this currency.
+with no central authority; where transaction management and issuance of money is performed collectively by its network. The name of the open source software which enables the use of this currency is Bitcoin Core.
comments.body: _the_ was left out on purpose here. There are multiple full node implementations.
